alert.note: Alert for Bastrop; Travis (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued March 21 at 6:29PM CDT until March 21 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM CDT FOR EAST CENTRAL TRAVIS AND NORTHWESTERN BASTROP COUNTIES... At 629 PM CDT, a confirmed tornado was located near Manor, or 7 miles southwest of Elgin, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Damaging tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar confirmed tornado. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Elgin, Webberville and Garfield. TORNADO...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a tornado is on the ground. TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Motorists should not take shelter under highway overpasses. If you cannot safely drive away from the tornado, as a last resort, either park your vehicle and stay put, or abandon your vehicle and lie down in a low lying area and protect yourself from flying debris.
